Detailed Description

Definitions for simple conditional variable operations.

Define Documentation

#define CTK_COND_EA ( cond_var   )     ((ctk_cond_ea_t)(unsigned long)(&(cond_var)))

A macro to get a cond-var reference for the given condition-variable.

Parameters:
[in] cond_var - a cond variable (ctk_cond_t)

#define CTK_COND_PTR ( cond_ea   )     ((ctk_cond_t*)(unsigned long)(cond_ea))

A macro to get a cond-var pointer from the given cond reference.

Parameters:
[in] cond_ea - a cond reference (ctk_cond_ea_t)

#define CTK_COND_VAR ( cond_ea   )     (*(ctk_cond_t*)(unsigned long)(cond_ea))

A macro to get a cond-var variable from the given cond reference.

Parameters:
[in] cond_ea - a cond reference (ctk_cond_ea_t)

Typedef Documentation

typedef ea_addr_t ctk_cond_ea_t

Conditional-variable reference type

Function Documentation

void ctk_cond_broadcast ( ctk_cond_ea_t  cond  ) 

Signals a broadcast on a conditional variable.

Parameters:
[in] cond - a conditional variable to be signaled.

int ctk_cond_create ( ctk_cond_ea_t *  cond  ) 

Creates a new cond-var reference. A new cond-var is allocated (by ctk_sync_alloc) and its reference is returned. (You can also directly declares a ctk_cond_t static variable and gets a reference for it using CTK_COND_EA macro.)

Parameters:
[out] cond - a created cond-var reference.

void ctk_cond_destroy ( ctk_cond_ea_t  cond  ) 

Destroys the given cond-var reference. Cond-var references created by ctk_cond_create must be destroyed by this routine.

Parameters:
[in] cond - a cond reference to be destroyed.

void ctk_cond_init ( ctk_cond_ea_t  cond  ) 

Initializes a conditional variable.

Parameters:
[in,out] cond - a conditional variable to be initialized.

void ctk_cond_signal ( ctk_cond_ea_t  cond  ) 

Signals on a conditional variable.

Parameters:
[in] cond - a conditional variable to be signaled.

void ctk_cond_wait ( ctk_cond_ea_t  cond,
ctk_mutex_ea_t  mutex 
)

Waits for a signal or broadcast to wait the condition.

Parameters:
[in] cond - a conditional variable for which the caller waits.
[in] mutex - a mutex lock; which must be held before calling this.
